ygData.subject: RE: How Lullaby used to be. (Results on how it is now)
ygData.msgSnippet: Must be a result produced by the solid internal testing department .  Of course you know in a dynamic world, strange things can happen.  Yeah the simplest
ygData.messageBody:
Must be a result produced by the "solid internal testing department". Of
course you know "in a dynamic world, strange things can happen." Yeah the
simplest things not working, and multiple sign errors are "strange things".
The only "strange things" I see is when they declare a change and it really
does work.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Roach [mailto:mike.roach@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 11:51 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] How Lullaby used to be. (Results on how it is
now)


From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>

Good lord!

Ok bards, new strategy! The lower your CHA the better, you've had it
backwards the whole time.

/perplex

Faras

> -----Original Message-----
> From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 12:48 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] How Lullaby used to be. (Results on how it is
> now)
>
>
> From: <kim@...>
>
> Ok, I ran the test again in BB, this time without my charisma
> equipment, and against a skunk. It blasted me with its spray
> and took my charisma down to 80:
>
> 501 pulses of Lullaby, 80 charisma, lute equipped
> 339 successful mesmerizes (67.6%)
> 143 secondary resists (28.5%)
> 19 outright resists (3.8%)
>
> To recap my test with the snake:
>
> 415 pulses of Lullaby, 154 charisma, lute equipped
> 242 successful mesmerizes (58.3%)
> 163 secondary resists (39.3%)
> 10 outright resists (2.4%)
>
> I'm going to run these tests a couple more times (against a
> snake this time after I've been sprayed by skunk musk). But
> it's *really* looking like there's a sign error for the
> charisma enhancement on Lullaby. With 80 charisma, for the
> first time I was getting secondary resist rates nearly as low
> as the 25% GZ was claiming we should get.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
